items.content_html: PaintRenderingContext2D has the same members as https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D and so they are all documented under CanvasRenderingContext2D. The mdn_url linter cannot know about this, so I'm adding these mdn_urls manually.
items.title: Add mdn_urls for PaintRenderingContext2D

items.content_html: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Path2D has all the Path members from https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D and so they are all documented under CanvasRenderingContext2D. The mdn_url linter cannot know about this, so I'm adding these mdn_urls manually.
items.title: Add mdn_urls for Path2D

items.content_html: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/OffscreenCanvasRenderingContext2D has the same members as https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D and so they are all documented under CanvasRenderingContext2D. The mdn_url linter cannot know about this, so I'm adding these mdn_urls manually.
items.title: Add mdn_urls for OffscreenCanvasRenderingContext2D

items.content_html: See openwebdocs/mdn-bcd-collector#1677 (apparently this is in the custom IDL in the OWD collector but I can't find it in specs or in browsers, so we should remove this)
items.title: Remove CSSStyleDeclaration.@@iterator

items.title: Remove obsolete api.CanvasRenderingContext2D.scrollPathIntoView

items.content_html:
Safari's A >> B syntax is gone for a long time and for Chrome, it looks like A >>> B is gone, too.
See https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/HX5Y8Ykr5Ns/m/2R_xIkOvCgAJ
items.title: Remove >> and >>> descendant syntax

items.content_html:
This PR removes the battery member of the Permissions-Policy HTTP header from BCD. Per the data guidelines, this feature can be considered irrelevant and may be removed from BCD accordingly. Even if the current data suggests that the feature is supported, lack of support has been confirmed by the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.12.1).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/http/headers/Permissions-Policy/battery
items.title: Remove http.headers.Permissions-Policy.battery from BCD

items.content_html:
FF129 Adds support for using MediaCapabilities.decodingInfo() with encoded media in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1898344

The spec is a bit messy, but what it means is that

  • you have a new property to the configuration object passed to that method called keySystemConfiguration.
  • The returned promise resolves to include two more properties,
    • keySystemAccess which is a MediaKeySystemAccess you can use to get keys and decode the content for playback.
    • configuration which is the whole config object you just passed in (not just the new keySystemConfiguration, but the stuff that predates it). Note however that this does not seem to be defined in returned objects on my testing - asking about it in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1898344#c20

What I have done is added a subfeature under decodingInfo() _justfor thekeySystemConfiguration` parameter. I haven't added another thing for the new values in the returned object - I was hoping that the existence of this subfeature could convey the existence of this whole feature

Can it? Or is there a better name for this like encrypted_media?

Related docs work can be tracked in mdn/content#34696
items.title: FF129 MediaCapabilities.decodingInfo() - encrypted content

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Chromium (Chrome, Opera, Samsung Internet, WebView Android) for the api member of the webextensions Web Extensions interface. This sets the feature(s) to a version range based upon the date that the feature was added to BCD with the intent of replacing true values with ranged values to eliminate true values from BCD.

Commit/PR Adding the Feature: #166

This is a cherry-pick of the files containing more complicated changes that were originally in #23450. While most of the features are set to ≤58, some were set to different version numbers to satisfy the consistency linter, or there was other readily available information already in BCD to confirm the earlier version number.
items.title: Update slightly complex Chromium data for webextensions.api

items.content_html:
The output of the update-browser-releases script is:

@mdn/browser-compat-data@5.5.40 update-browser-releases
node --loader=ts-node/esm --no-warnings=ExperimentalWarning scripts/update-browser-releases/index.ts --all

Updates for Firefox for Desktop

  • New status for firefox 115: retired, previously esr.
  • New status for firefox 128: esr, previously current.

Updates for Firefox for Android

  • New status for firefox_android 115: retired, previously esr.
  • New status for firefox_android 128: esr, previously current.

Updates for Safari for Desktop

  • New status for safari 17.5: retired, previously current.
  • New status for safari 17.6: current, previously beta.

Updates for Safari for iOS

  • New status for safari_ios 17.5: retired, previously current.
  • New status for safari_ios 17.6: current, previously beta.
items.title: Update browser releases

items.content_html: This PR adds WKWebView to BCD, which fixes #23296. The data will be set to mirror for all features at first, which will occur in a follow-up PR.
items.title: Add WKWebView to BCD

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

items.content_html: This PR updates and corrects version values for Safari (Desktop and iOS/iPadOS) for the autofocus member of the global_attributes HTML feature. This fixes #23457, which contains the supporting evidence for this change.
items.title: Update Safari data for html.global_attributes.autofocus

items.content_html:
This PR adds the missing features of the Collator.Collator member of the Intl JavaScript builtin. The data comes from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.11.0).

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

items.title: Add missing features for javascript.builtins.Intl.Collator.Collator

items.content_html:
This PR sorts out the data regarding the autoplay attribute on <audio> and <video> elements, which resolves #7342.

When looking at the data, I happened to notice that the only mention of autoplay prohibited with an audio track was a note on Safari iOS, but from my own development experience, I found that Chrome Desktop also prohibited autoplaying audio. As such, I decided to add a new subfeature for the attribute on the <video> element according to my findings.

Additionally, I had marked the attribute on <audio> elements as unsupported for when the browsers blocked automatic playback of audio. Although the browser may recognize the attribute and it may still be present on the interface counterpart, setting the attribute will do nothing.
items.title: Sort out autoplay data
